intro: Ornithocephalus manabina, commonly known as the Manabí orchid, is a rare and endangered species native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its unique inflorescence and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within cloud forests. Its flowers are small and delicate, often displaying a mix of white, green, and yellow hues. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
